column4: do the new kernel images released have any sort of ide changes?
not specifically, no. are you having a problem?
what was the last kernel where it worked?
and what is the error message you see?
hold on, I'll get the bug#
I see, so this is a problem with the install CD?
the new kernel has not propagated onto the install CDs yet
what is the error message that you see when it fails?
there are two different dialogs which contain the text "No common CD-ROM drive was detected"
one asks if you want to load drivers from a floppy, and the other offers to let you select a cd-rom driver. which one did you see?
please attach the complete dmesg output to the bug
when you boot the installed system, do you get the same problem or a different one?
added dmesg output to bug..hope it helps
you can still use a static /dev
yea, I didn't know if that was a udev or distro specific option
